summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Certification of Identity form completed by Michael C. Miller on August 23, 2019, to request records under the Privacy Act. The form includes his personal details and a declaration under penalty of perjury, but does not specify the subject of the records sought.

persons.name: Michael C. Miller
persons.context: Individual submitting a Privacy Act request to the U.S. Department of Justice by completing and signing this certification of identity form.

events.title: Submission of Privacy Act Request
events.description: Michael C. Miller signs and submits a Certification of Identity form to the U.S. Department of Justice to request records under the Privacy Act.

locations: 1114 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10036
keyFacts: Michael C. Miller submitted a Privacy Act request to the U.S. Department of Justice on August 23, 2019.
The form is a standard DOJ certification (Form DOJ-361) used to verify the identity of a requester to prevent wrongful disclosure of records.
The requester's address is listed as 1114 Avenue of the Americas in New York City.
The form does not specify the subject or name of the individual whose records are being sought, leaving that section blank.
The document is part of the Epstein case file release, suggesting the request may be related to obtaining information on the Epstein case.
